algorithm_technique: Greedy approach: For each element, subtract the largest possible prime less than the difference to the previous element.
problem_summary_simple: Determine if an array can be made strictly increasing by subtracting primes from its elements.
problem_summary_technical: Iterate through the array, greedily subtracting the largest valid prime to satisfy the strictly increasing condition.
key_insights: A greedy strategy works because we want to make the current number as small as possible while satisfying the condition.
Pre-computing primes using a sieve is efficient for repeated lookups.
Binary search (bisect_left) helps find the appropriate prime quickly.
